headline: Disney’s Business Model is Turning Kids Into Dysfunctional Adults
author: Daniel Greenfield
sentences: During the 90s, while Disney's more family friendly brand was releasing animated cartoons, Miramax featured Pulp Fiction, Trainspotting, and the Scream sequels.
That didn’t last long after Walt's death as Disney started releasing R-rated movies and adult television programming under the Touchstone label.
Walt’s unique strategy of building an entertainment empire for kids once made Disney a trusted source of family entertainment.
(snip) In the new century the barrier between the two schizoid faces of Disney has come down.
“Our greatest natural resource is the minds of our children," Walt Disney once said.

Comments:
So, now it’s “Disney’s my name and perversion’s my game”… poor old Walt.
A perfectionist who could be ugly about keeping his company’s product that way.
During this time Weinstein was accused of sexual harassment and assaults.
A decade later, Disney bought Harvey Weinstein’s Miramax.
A tough guy, he ran a very taut ship.
The inmates now run another asylum.
